**How Do You Determine Whether A News Source Is Reputable? Or A News Story Is Reliable?**

In this internet age, it is possible to find several sources of news and information online. However, not all of them are equally reliable. For most people, it is usually difficult to tell the difference between a true story and fake news. Even the false stories have populated the internet and the real ones are rare to find. 

It is observed that false stories are invented to grab audience attention and to mislead readers. Such untrue and biased stories create political profits or may be used by some business brands as well to build their reputation. But for readers, it is really important to ensure that they are going through the most trusted and relevant platforms. 

There are few important aspects of [news](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/News) stories that you need to evaluate to determine whether they are reliable or not. 

**Accuracy**

First of all, you need to verify the information on the source against what you already know about the issue. It is also good to look for the disclaimers to ensure the accuracy of the available content. You may also need to double-check the information on some other trustworthy source to cross-verify the accuracy of facts and figures. Even if the source is using technical language, it is possible to find some misleading content. 

**Authority**

It is important to ensure that the information is curated and written by a trustworthy author. In case if you are following a webpage, you can easily identify the publisher or owner through URLs, you can also check the copyright statement by the end of the page. Make sure that the publisher or author has all relevant credentials of the specific subject matter. At the same time, you need to check if the source is biased. For instance, the content may be biased towards a specific political party or a company. 

**Currency**

Depending upon the subject matter, the currency needs may also vary. When the topic is related to recent advancements in the field of technology and medicine, it is necessary to find up-to-date sources. However, if you are looking for a historical topic, it is better to refer to the older resources. For web pages, it is possible to find the copyright date on the bottom of the page. You can also check for few relevant words like ‘updated’ or ‘revised’ to ensure adequate material. 

**Coverage**

You may also need to examine the source of the content and evaluate how it fits the specific information required. It is better to identify the relevancy of content to the topic while ensuring that it addresses the respective subject matter in the most accurate manner. One needs to ensure that the source contains in-depth information with adequate references, graphs, facts, and figures.
